title: labChartHRV
text: â€™ve analysed HRV data LabChart, follow steps export HRV report: Go menu HRV -> Export Report... -> save file .txt Open file, look like :  can see, text file slightly formatted store data key-value pairs (mostly). transform data analysis can performed? process data analysis, one approach convert table-like data structure , R, data frame (tibble). design data frame tidy, meaning column names variables, rows represent single subject. (example, converted 1 row data frame.) takes time effort manually transforms table can even harder number subject grows. â€™s â€™ve build package!

title: labChartHRV
text: read_HRV_reports() read transform LabChartâ€™s HRV report file (.txt) tidy tibble. first argument (file) path either single HRV report file folder containing multiple HRV report file, latter case useful . 4 HRV report .txt files folder. Now, just supply path folder import . (Note: Internally read_HRV_reports() use readtext::readtext() read textual data. â€™ve set text encoding UTF-16LE. found output looks abnormal try changing text encoding via argument encoding.) hrv_tbl 41 columns 4 rows. Column names correspond fields HRV report, rows correspond HRV report files. description columns stored HRV_vars_desc data frame.
code: library(labChartHRV) # Path to a folder containing example HRV report text files path_hrv <- labChartHRV_example("HRV") path_hrv #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/labChartHRV/extdata/HRV" dir(path_hrv) #> [1] "file1.txt" "file2.txt" "file3.txt" "file4.txt" # Read In hrv_tbl <- read_HRV_reports(path_hrv) hrv_tbl #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 41 #>   doc_id    File_LabChart Channel   Date  Start_time End_time Name  Gender   Age #>   <chr>     <chr>         <fct>     <chr> <chr>      <chr>    <chr> <fct>  <int> #> 1 file1.txt file1         Channel 2 16/2â€¦ 16/2/2563â€¦ 16/2/25â€¦ John  Male      60 #> 2 file2.txt file2         Channel 2 26/3â€¦ 26/3/2563â€¦ 26/3/25â€¦ Max   Male      56 #> 3 file3.txt file3         Channel 2 19/8â€¦ 19/8/2563â€¦ 19/8/25â€¦ Mary  Female    65 #> 4 file4.txt file4         Channel 2 10/9â€¦ 19/10/256â€¦ 19/10/2â€¦ Tom   Female    63 #> # â€¦ with 32 more variables: Beats_tot <dbl>, Rec_length <dbl>, #> #   Class_bound <chr>, Discontinuities <dbl>, Beats_inserted <dbl>, #> #   Beats_deleted <dbl>, NN_max <dbl>, NN_min <dbl>, NN_range <dbl>, #> #   NN_mean <dbl>, NN_median <dbl>, HR_avg <dbl>, SDNN <dbl>, SD_del_NN <dbl>, #> #   RMSSD <dbl>, Normals_count <dbl>, Ectopics_count <dbl>, #> #   Artifacts_count <dbl>, NN50_count <dbl>, NN50_percent <dbl>, #> #   Spec_intv <dbl>, Spec_mean_NN <dbl>, Power_tot <dbl>, VLF_freq <chr>, â€¦ # Column Names names(hrv_tbl) #>  [1] "doc_id"          "File_LabChart"   "Channel"         "Date"            #>  [5] "Start_time"      "End_time"        "Name"            "Gender"          #>  [9] "Age"             "Beats_tot"       "Rec_length"      "Class_bound"     #> [13] "Discontinuities" "Beats_inserted"  "Beats_deleted"   "NN_max"          #> [17] "NN_min"          "NN_range"        "NN_mean"         "NN_median"       #> [21] "HR_avg"          "SDNN"            "SD_del_NN"       "RMSSD"           #> [25] "Normals_count"   "Ectopics_count"  "Artifacts_count" "NN50_count"      #> [29] "NN50_percent"    "Spec_intv"       "Spec_mean_NN"    "Power_tot"       #> [33] "VLF_freq"        "VLF"             "LF_freq"         "LF"              #> [37] "LF_nu"           "HF_freq"         "HF"              "HF_nu"           #> [41] "LF_HF" HRV_vars_desc #> # A tibble: 40 Ã— 2 #>    variable      description             #>    <chr>         <chr>                   #>  1 File_LabChart LabChart file name      #>  2 Channel       Channel                 #>  3 Date          Date                    #>  4 Start_time    Start time              #>  5 End_time      End time                #>  6 Name          Name                    #>  7 Gender        Gender                  #>  8 Age           Age                     #>  9 Beats_tot     Total number of beats   #> 10 Rec_length    Length of recording (s) #> # â€¦ with 30 more rows

title: labChartHRV
text: parse_HRV_reports() lower-level function parse HRV report character vector data frame.

title: labChartHRV
text: First, need read HRV report character vector using text reading engine choice.
code: # Path to an HRV report text file path_hrv1 <- labChartHRV_example("HRV/file1.txt")  # Read into character vector, I use `{readtext}` hrv_chr <- readtext::readtext(path_hrv1,                                encoding = "UTF-16LE")$text # For nice printing glue::as_glue(hrv_chr)  #> File: "file1"  Channel: Channel 2     Date: 16/2/2563 14:32:07.169 #> Start time: 16/2/2563 13:30:45.811    End time: 16/2/2563 13:45:46.061  #> Name: John    Gender: Male    Age: 60  #> Total number of beats = 485 (484 valid intervals, ectopics excluded)     Length of recording = 300.250 s #> Classification boundaries: Artifact < 5 <= Ectopic < 179.364 <= Normal <= 1000 < Ectopic <= 2000 < Artifact #> Discontinuities = 0    Manually inserted beats = 0    Manually deleted beats = 0 #> Maximum NN = 642.492 ms    Minimum NN = 192.683 ms    Range = 449.81 ms #> Mean NN = 619.058 ms    Median NN = 621.648 ms    Average heart rate = 96.9215 BPM #> SDNN = 23.1491 ms    SD of delta NN = 24.4761 ms    Ratio = 0.945783    RMSSD = 24.4508 #> Normals = 484 (100%)    Ectopics = 0 (0%)    Artifacts = 0 (0%)    NN50 = 3 (0.619835%) #> Spectrum intervals = 484   Mean spectrum NN = 619.058 ms #> Total power = 692.124 msÂ²    VLF (DC-0.04Hz) = 114.5 msÂ² #> LF (0.04-0.15Hz) = 153.873 msÂ² (26.639 nu)     HF (0.15-0.4Hz) = 255.602 msÂ² (44.2506 nu)    LF/HF = 0.602002

title: labChartHRV
text: Now parse character vector data frame. Since â€™ve import 1 HRV report character vector length 1, resulting data frame 1 row. However, can supply HRV report character vector > 1 length, resulting data frame multiple rows corresponding HRV reports. Last updated: 2022-04-11
code: parse_HRV_reports(hrv_chr) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 40 #>   File_LabChart Channel   Date  Start_time End_time Name  Gender   Age Beats_tot #>   <chr>         <fct>     <chr> <chr>      <chr>    <chr> <fct>  <int>     <dbl> #> 1 file1         Channel 2 16/2â€¦ 16/2/2563â€¦ 16/2/25â€¦ John  Male      60       485 #> # â€¦ with 31 more variables: Rec_length <dbl>, Class_bound <chr>, #> #   Discontinuities <dbl>, Beats_inserted <dbl>, Beats_deleted <dbl>, #> #   NN_max <dbl>, NN_min <dbl>, NN_range <dbl>, NN_mean <dbl>, NN_median <dbl>, #> #   HR_avg <dbl>, SDNN <dbl>, SD_del_NN <dbl>, RMSSD <dbl>, #> #   Normals_count <dbl>, Ectopics_count <dbl>, Artifacts_count <dbl>, #> #   NN50_count <dbl>, NN50_percent <dbl>, Spec_intv <dbl>, Spec_mean_NN <dbl>, #> #   Power_tot <dbl>, VLF_freq <chr>, VLF <dbl>, LF_freq <chr>, LF <dbl>, â€¦

title: LabChart's HRV Data Import and Manipulation
text: labChartHRV open-source software package written R programming language. R package contains functions data import manipulation LabChartâ€™s HRV module. Functionality: Import transform LabChartâ€™s HRV report file (.txt) tibble (data frame).

title: LabChart's HRV Data Import and Manipulation
text: LabChartâ€™s HRV report file (.txt) 1 subject.  transform 1-row data frame analysis? Moreover, multiple text files, can transform data frame rows corresponding subjects? labChartHRV package functions solve problems

title: LabChart's HRV Data Import and Manipulation
text: package comes example data LabChartâ€™s HRV report file(s) .txt. Read HRV report file(s) .txt data frame calling read_HRV_reports() path either single HRV report folder containing multiple reports. hrv_tbl tibble (data frame) Columns variables including results time-frequency-domain HRV analysis. Rows corresponding report files (.e., subjects). Variableâ€™s description store data frame:
code: library(labChartHRV) # Path to a folder containing example HRV report text files path_hrv <- labChartHRV_example("HRV") dir(path_hrv) #> [1] "file1.txt" "file2.txt" "file3.txt" "file4.txt" # Read multiple HRV report files from a folder hrv_tbl <- read_HRV_reports(path_hrv) hrv_tbl #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 41 #>   doc_id    File_LabChart Channel   Date  Start_time End_time Name  Gender   Age #>   <chr>     <chr>         <fct>     <chr> <chr>      <chr>    <chr> <fct>  <int> #> 1 file1.txt file1         Channel 2 16/2â€¦ 16/2/2563â€¦ 16/2/25â€¦ John  Male      60 #> 2 file2.txt file2         Channel 2 26/3â€¦ 26/3/2563â€¦ 26/3/25â€¦ Max   Male      56 #> 3 file3.txt file3         Channel 2 19/8â€¦ 19/8/2563â€¦ 19/8/25â€¦ Mary  Female    65 #> 4 file4.txt file4         Channel 2 10/9â€¦ 19/10/256â€¦ 19/10/2â€¦ Tom   Female    63 #> # â€¦ with 32 more variables: Beats_tot <dbl>, Rec_length <dbl>, #> #   Class_bound <chr>, Discontinuities <dbl>, Beats_inserted <dbl>, #> #   Beats_deleted <dbl>, NN_max <dbl>, NN_min <dbl>, NN_range <dbl>, #> #   NN_mean <dbl>, NN_median <dbl>, HR_avg <dbl>, SDNN <dbl>, SD_del_NN <dbl>, #> #   RMSSD <dbl>, Normals_count <dbl>, Ectopics_count <dbl>, #> #   Artifacts_count <dbl>, NN50_count <dbl>, NN50_percent <dbl>, #> #   Spec_intv <dbl>, Spec_mean_NN <dbl>, Power_tot <dbl>, VLF_freq <chr>, â€¦ # Variable names names(hrv_tbl) #>  [1] "doc_id"          "File_LabChart"   "Channel"         "Date"            #>  [5] "Start_time"      "End_time"        "Name"            "Gender"          #>  [9] "Age"             "Beats_tot"       "Rec_length"      "Class_bound"     #> [13] "Discontinuities" "Beats_inserted"  "Beats_deleted"   "NN_max"          #> [17] "NN_min"          "NN_range"        "NN_mean"         "NN_median"       #> [21] "HR_avg"          "SDNN"            "SD_del_NN"       "RMSSD"           #> [25] "Normals_count"   "Ectopics_count"  "Artifacts_count" "NN50_count"      #> [29] "NN50_percent"    "Spec_intv"       "Spec_mean_NN"    "Power_tot"       #> [33] "VLF_freq"        "VLF"             "LF_freq"         "LF"              #> [37] "LF_nu"           "HF_freq"         "HF"              "HF_nu"           #> [41] "LF_HF" HRV_vars_desc #> # A tibble: 40 Ã— 2 #>    variable      description             #>    <chr>         <chr>                   #>  1 File_LabChart LabChart file name      #>  2 Channel       Channel                 #>  3 Date          Date                    #>  4 Start_time    Start time              #>  5 End_time      End time                #>  6 Name          Name                    #>  7 Gender        Gender                  #>  8 Age           Age                     #>  9 Beats_tot     Total number of beats   #> 10 Rec_length    Length of recording (s) #> # â€¦ with 30 more rows

title: Parse LabChart's HRV Report â€” parse_HRV_reports
text: tibble HRV report (one row per subject)

title: Parse LabChart's HRV Report â€” parse_HRV_reports
text: parse_HRV_reports() extracts key value pairs fields LabChart's HRV report supplied character vectors using regular expression pattern matching. Extracted data transform tibble "key" mapping column names "value" mapping corresponding cells. x given character vector length > 1, multiple rows tibble rows corresponding input character vectors.

title: Parse LabChart's HRV Report â€” parse_HRV_reports
code: # Read HRV report to a character vector. Using any reading engine as you like. hrv_chr <- readtext::readtext(labChartHRV_example("HRV/file1.txt"),                               encoding = "UTF-16LE")$text # Parse into a tibble parse_HRV_reports(hrv_chr) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 40 #>   File_LabChart Channel   Date  Start_time End_time Name  Gender   Age Beats_tot #>   <chr>         <fct>     <chr> <chr>      <chr>    <chr> <fct>  <int>     <dbl> #> 1 file1         Channel 2 16/2â€¦ 16/2/2563â€¦ 16/2/25â€¦ John  Male      60       485 #> # â€¦ with 31 more variables: Rec_length <dbl>, Class_bound <chr>, #> #   Discontinuities <dbl>, Beats_inserted <dbl>, Beats_deleted <dbl>, #> #   NN_max <dbl>, NN_min <dbl>, NN_range <dbl>, NN_mean <dbl>, NN_median <dbl>, #> #   HR_avg <dbl>, SDNN <dbl>, SD_del_NN <dbl>, RMSSD <dbl>, #> #   Normals_count <dbl>, Ectopics_count <dbl>, Artifacts_count <dbl>, #> #   NN50_count <dbl>, NN50_percent <dbl>, Spec_intv <dbl>, Spec_mean_NN <dbl>, #> #   Power_tot <dbl>, VLF_freq <chr>, VLF <dbl>, LF_freq <chr>, LF <dbl>, â€¦

what: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
title: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
text: Read transform LabChart's HRV report file (.txt) tidy tibble one row per file.

title: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
text: file (Character) Path LabChart's HRV report (.txt) files read. Path can point individual text file (.txt) folder contains files. format_cols (Logical) TRUE formats appropriate output variables factor, integer, double, compute NN50_percent (pNN50) NN50_count/Normals_count encoding (Character) Text encoding HRV report files. Default value set "UTF-16LE" works well testing data. result seems abnormal, try different text encoding (visit readtext manual see available options) ... extra arguments passed readtext::readtext()

title: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
text: tibble HRV report (one row per subject)

title: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
text: read_HRV_reports() reads contents LabChart's HRV report text file (.txt) character vector using readtext::readtext() function default text encoding "UTF-16LE". , key-value fields character vector extracted transform tibble regular expression pattern matching parse_HRV_reports(). result tibble column names corresponding "key" input file(s), values rows mapped "value" input file(s).

title: Read LabChart's HRV Report File â€” read_HRV_reports
code: # Path to `HRV/` folder containing example HRV report files (`.txt`) path <- labChartHRV_example("HRV") # Read into tibble read_HRV_reports(path) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 41 #>   doc_id    File_LabChart Channel   Date  Start_time End_time Name  Gender   Age #>   <chr>     <chr>         <fct>     <chr> <chr>      <chr>    <chr> <fct>  <int> #> 1 file1.txt file1         Channel 2 16/2â€¦ 16/2/2563â€¦ 16/2/25â€¦ John  Male      60 #> 2 file2.txt file2         Channel 2 26/3â€¦ 26/3/2563â€¦ 26/3/25â€¦ Max   Male      56 #> 3 file3.txt file3         Channel 2 19/8â€¦ 19/8/2563â€¦ 19/8/25â€¦ Mary  Female    65 #> 4 file4.txt file4         Channel 2 10/9â€¦ 19/10/256â€¦ 19/10/2â€¦ Tom   Female    63 #> # â€¦ with 32 more variables: Beats_tot <dbl>, Rec_length <dbl>, #> #   Class_bound <chr>, Discontinuities <dbl>, Beats_inserted <dbl>, #> #   Beats_deleted <dbl>, NN_max <dbl>, NN_min <dbl>, NN_range <dbl>, #> #   NN_mean <dbl>, NN_median <dbl>, HR_avg <dbl>, SDNN <dbl>, SD_del_NN <dbl>, #> #   RMSSD <dbl>, Normals_count <dbl>, Ectopics_count <dbl>, #> #   Artifacts_count <dbl>, NN50_count <dbl>, NN50_percent <dbl>, #> #   Spec_intv <dbl>, Spec_mean_NN <dbl>, Power_tot <dbl>, VLF_freq <chr>, â€¦
